Text: Homestead FL x LM PC OM Estimate Cc find attached an OM cost estimate for one oil fired x LMPC power project located in Homestead FL The estimate assumes run hours in simple cycle during the first year without SCR and run hours in combined cycle for years with SCR Given that its combined cycle in years the staffing plan is assuming year round availability needs except for agreed upon Scheduled Outages Please note the increase in GT Major Scheduled Maintenance costs due to liquid firing Please review it and let me know if you have questions or comments Mark and Tom sorry for the short notice Can you please review and provide comment particularly on the proposed staffing plan and Operator fees regards Scot

St Peter ILL Ameren OM Cost Estimate Cc find attached the preliminary cost estimate for full OM services provided at one greenfield stand alone x LM PC Sprint simple cycle power project located at St Peter Illinois The project is assumed to be gasfired and operating hrs per year in the months of May through September The staffing plan does not anticipate operations during the other months of the year The tentative schedule is NTP and COD Ameren is to own and operate A couple of questions Where is Amerens headquarters located ie the home office where their OM staff would get their admin technical support Who will own and operate the same plant that Spectrum is building miles to the north of St Peter Please review and call should you have questions or comments regards Scot

UAE Lowell MA xLM PC Project Rev Cc find attached revision two to the UAE Lowell Massachusetts LM simple cycle peaking facility which is to be located at an existing staffed cogen facility The second revisions are due to the following changes in assumptions Further reduced the staffing costs due to no allocation of labor being assumed from existing plant to peaking plant and the addition of only ONE tech to cover the expansion OM per your discussion with UAE Restated the Annual Routine Maintenance costs components of FOM and VOM to FOM and VOM Please call if you have questions or want to discuss further regards Scot

Re LM Proforma OM Questionaireplease use these for TECO thanks Scot Forwarded by Scot ChambersENRONDEVELOPMENT on PM Scot Chambers AM To Robert E CT cc Mike ColemanENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject Re LM Proforma OM Questionaire Bob heres the blank forms for info Also there is a questionnaire written for SC LM plants Answer what you can and ignore if na or redundant The DePere info sheet is in hardcopy since we did it over in your workstation Ill have a copy faxed Please provide you fax thanks

UAE Lowell MA xLM PC Project Cc find attached revision one to the UAE Lowell Massachusetts LM simple cycle peaking facility which is to be located at an existing staffed cogen facility The revisions are due to the following changes in assumptions Increased annual maintenance costs due to going from to LMPC Enhanced Sprints units being installed This increases the CO SCR units compression capacity and the chiller capacity Some consumables increase as well test gases for CEMS oils greases etc Chemical costs increased due to NOx emissions limit from ppm to ppm Amount of aqueous ammonia changed from lbshr to lbshr per Peerless Inc quote they package the CO SCR system using solution which keeps operator below EPA RMP threshold of Reduced the staffing costs due to no allocation of labor being assumed from existing plant to peaking plant per your discussion with UAE Two OM tech staff adds are shown to cover the peaking operation only Chemical costs increased due to more throughput required Assuming a RO mixed beds installation per Bruce Golden Increase in OM Fee from Myr to Myr due to scope increase Major Maintenance dollar value increased in absolute terms due to adding one more GTG fyi fired hr stays the same Please call if you have questions or want to discuss further regards Scot

Rochester Public Utilities Preliminary OM Estimate Cc find attached below the preliminary OM cost estimate for RPUs OM services to mobilize and operate the x LM peaking facility to be situated in Rochester Minnesota As we discussed it assumes that Rochester Public Utilities has no existing staff and infrastructure in the area but if this assumption should change then Mobilization and annual Operating fixed OM could be reduced as a result of leveraging existing RPU staff and facilities Please review it and consider its accuracy to be Call if you have any questions

Lowell MA OM Estimateplease find attached below the preliminary OM cost estimate for OM services to mobilize and operate the x LM peaking facility to be situated at an existing UAE cogen plant in Lowell Mass It assumes some allocated costs for common facilities operatingadmin expenses and staff at the UAE plant to be added to the incremental expenses that are estimated to occur as a result of the plant addition Please review it and consider its accuracy to be Call if you have any questions Forwarded by Scot ChambersENRONDEVELOPMENT on PM Scot Chambers PM To Mark DoblerENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Tom CallaghanENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT David EhlerENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Mitch RobinsonENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT John W CatesENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Richard BickingsENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject Lowell MA OM Estimate Please review the attached OM estimate for the Lowell Massachusetts x LM peaking facility to be situated at an existing UAE cogen plant UAE will own and operate the plant and ENA will have option on the output for about to years The OM cost estimate shown assumes the hire of OM techs to cover the LM plant for the peak period shifts Current staff at UAE plant is reported as total including admin which seems low for a cogen so Ive shown the addition of techs It assumes an allocation of some existing labor and adminoperating costs from the existing plant but in no case is the annual total for the fixed costs more than of what we could do it for ourselves if it was stand alone Maintenance and chemicals are shown as variable The fees are shown for what we used for the Wilton Center Expansion M Mob M Annual Ops thanks Scot

Santee Cooper OM Estimate Revision Cc Webb please find attached revision one to the Santee Cooper OM cost estimate It is for mobilization and operating period OM services for one gas fired x LM simple cycle peaking facility located at the Georgia and South Carolina border The revision made adjustments to the following Rev Rev Mobilization fee Annual Operating fee Annual Maintenance cost Estimate Mobilization Labor cost adjusted benefits Annual Labor cost adjusted benefits Initial Spare Parts My reasoning is this After consulting with OEC the previous fees were not believed to be at market Annual Maintenance was recalculated after having more time to do a bottom up estimate Mob and annual labor costs changed due to a change in OEC benefits calculations Initial spares rounded down As we discussed the GT major maintenance is scheduled to occur in year of an year term Please provide your comments regards Scot

Re Cc When do you need an OM estimate by and what are your accuracy requirements I have a couple other projects in the hopper that Im working on now For an accuracy of I can have you numbers by this FridayMonday timeframe If you require accuracy I would need until next ThursdayFriday timeframe assuming good information is available For this type accuracy were also going to need to know about water sourcetreatment plant design etc From talking with Bruce Golden my guess is that we are not there yet on design so you may be looking for the accuracy estimate for now FYI Bruce Golden is also filling in an eval form thanks and regards Scot Benjamin CT AM To Scot ChambersENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Tom CT Subject Re Bruce did give us project cost numbers and I will have him email them to you Also you and I already went through the project eval form on USEC Tom and I were trying to get numbers by Wednesday but give me a call once you get the project cost numbers Thanks for your help with this project Ben

ReBruce EECCNEPCO give project cost numbers In order to calculate FOM and VOM Ill need to know more about the project Can we discuss later this week say Thursday Please try to answer these questions in the two attached files thanks Benjamin CT PM To Scot ChambersENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject Tom Swank the originator and I sat down with Bruce Golden and went through the porject cost numbers for the GE FA combined cycle facility At this point we need to claculate FOM and VOM and other operating expenses We feel pretty good about the project cost numbers Let me know if you need more info than I have already given you Bruce Golden has the soft copy of the project cost numbers Thanks Ben

ReI have a reference document called Gas Turbine World Handbook in which I look up these type of answers as well for ballpark info They are the preliminary answer to your question and should be treated as so Please keep in mind that these are numbers from a magazine not from our internal PerformanceCycles group under Gary Bush within EECC They are the dept that the Dev Engineer typically consults with to arrive at a projects capacity and efficiency both from a new clean standpoint and an average degradation standpoint The depts within EECCNEPCO also come up with the total installed costs It is their numbers that are the ones that we typically bid in a proforma as such they are a part of the deal approval process DASH Their buy in is important because in addition to the numbers that OEMs provide us they factor in experience judgement unique project characteristics design basis intakeexhaust losses etc They also look at the net power for the Plant not just the equipment itself Having caveated these numbers I would respond to your questions below as follows PGFA Capacity kW each generator terminals ISO conditions gas fired baseload does not include auxiliaries usage duct losses MW Net Plant ISO gas fired BtukWh LHV ISO gas fired Plug figure for GTG may be each No idea on the ST swag at kW Power island turnkey for x may be kW does not include alot of stuff such as addl options development costs tieins permitting spares etc etc etc Hope this is useful to you somehow but please go to the source described above for anything that we are going to hang our hat on Benjamin CT AM To Scot ChambersENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject With regards to our conversation yesterday I am loking for basic economics regarding GE FAs Such as output per turbine output for FA and steam turbines Heat Rates and cost per turbine and steam turbine Total plant output will need to be MWs and will be run as a combined cycle facility If you could get me these numbers by the end of the day or call me to discuss what you currently have that would be great This project is not due till Wednesday Thanks Ben

Re Santee Cooper Project Preliminary OM EstimateClement Ben got your calls sorry havent returned them yet but Im swamped this week LM marathonorama Hows tomorrow afternoon sometime pm If there are no rooms available in EB I can probably get one over here in AC fairly easily We can review both estimates if you like Let me know if this works for you all Clement CT PM To Scot ChambersENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject Re Santee Cooper Project Preliminary OM Estimate Scot I would like to further discuss the analysis and format you have provided us for Lincoln and Santee Cooper Besides me I might include George McCormick Ben Rogers and Doug Sewell in the meeting Please let me know your availability and I would set up a meeting room Thanks Scot NRONDEVELOPMENT PM To George NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Clement NRONDEVELOPMENT Doug NRONDEVELOPMENT Benjamin NRONDEVELOPMENT Mike ColemanENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Richard BickingsENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Tom CallaghanENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Mark DoblerENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Mitch RobinsonENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject Santee Cooper Project Preliminary OM Estimate George please find attached the subject preliminary OM estimate consider it with an accuracy of at best Please review and call should you have questions regards Scot

Lincoln Nebraska Preliminary OM Estimate Cc file here attached is formatted for printing Please trash the last file in favor of this one regards Scot Forwarded by Scot ChambersENRONDEVELOPMENT on PM Scot Chambers PM To Benjamin NRONDEVELOPMENT Oscar NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Mark DoblerENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT John W CatesENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Tom CallaghanENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Richard BickingsENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject Lincoln Nebraska Preliminary OM Estimate Ben please find attached the preliminary OM estimate for the Lincoln NE project that we discussed It shows OM cost estimates for a year period assuming a stand alone plant with Availability required Monday Friday am to pm during the peak seasons hence operating shifts of staff The GT major maintenance accrual is also shown assuming no membership in the Lease Engine Membership program Since we will be buying the output of the plant from the Owner Operator LES during a contract period we may consider not showing them these numbers Before tipping our hand Id like to see what they plan to charge us for the OM portion of the power they provide us during the agreement period Please review these and the other assumptions to ensure that I understand the project correctly at this point especially the water treatment part Since its preliminary in nature please consider its accuracy for our proforma purposes If LES is to provide what they feel the OM would be please let me in on their numbers so we can provide our experience thanks Scot

Lincoln Nebraska Preliminary OM Estimate Cc find attached the preliminary OM estimate for the Lincoln NE project that we discussed It shows OM cost estimates for a year period assuming a stand alone plant with Availability required Monday Friday am to pm during the peak seasons hence operating shifts of staff The GT major maintenance accrual is also shown assuming no membership in the Lease Engine Membership program Since we will be buying the output of the plant from the Owner Operator LES during a contract period we may consider not showing them these numbers Before tipping our hand Id like to see what they plan to charge us for the OM portion of the power they provide us during the agreement period Please review these and the other assumptions to ensure that I understand the project correctly at this point especially the water treatment part Since its preliminary in nature please consider its accuracy for our proforma purposes If LES is to provide what they feel the OM would be please let me in on their numbers so we can provide our experience thanks Scot

Lincoln Nebraska Preliminary OM Estimate Cc file here attached is formatted for printing Please trash the last file in favor of this one regards Scot Forwarded by Scot ChambersENRONDEVELOPMENT on PM Scot Chambers PM To Benjamin NRONDEVELOPMENT Oscar NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Mark DoblerENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT John W CatesENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Tom CallaghanENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Richard BickingsENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject Lincoln Nebraska Preliminary OM Estimate Ben please find attached the preliminary OM estimate for the Lincoln NE project that we discussed It shows OM cost estimates for a year period assuming a stand alone plant with Availability required Monday Friday am to pm during the peak seasons hence operating shifts of staff The GT major maintenance accrual is also shown assuming no membership in the Lease Engine Membership program Since we will be buying the output of the plant from the Owner Operator LES during a contract period we may consider not showing them these numbers Before tipping our hand Id like to see what they plan to charge us for the OM portion of the power they provide us during the agreement period Please review these and the other assumptions to ensure that I understand the project correctly at this point especially the water treatment part Since its preliminary in nature please consider its accuracy for our proforma purposes If LES is to provide what they feel the OM would be please let me in on their numbers so we can provide our experience thanks Scot

UAE Lowell MA xLM PC Project Cc find attached revision one to the UAE Lowell Massachusetts LM simple cycle peaking facility which is to be located at an existing staffed cogen facility The revisions are due to the following changes in assumptions Increased annual maintenance costs due to going from to LMPC Enhanced Sprints units being installed This increases the CO SCR units compression capacity and the chiller capacity Some consumables increase as well test gases for CEMS oils greases etc Chemical costs increased due to NOx emissions limit from ppm to ppm Amount of aqueous ammonia changed from lbshr to lbshr per Peerless Inc quote they package the CO SCR system using solution which keeps operator below EPA RMP threshold of Reduced the staffing costs due to no allocation of labor being assumed from existing plant to peaking plant per your discussion with UAE Two OM tech staff adds are shown to cover the peaking operation only Chemical costs increased due to more throughput required Assuming a RO mixed beds installation per Bruce Golden Increase in OM Fee from Myr to Myr due to scope increase Major Maintenance dollar value increased in absolute terms due to adding one more GTG fyi fired hr stays the same Please call if you have questions or want to discuss further regards Scot
